DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Single Viral CDS
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Single Viral CDS
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For complete or partial single coding sequence (CDS) from a viral gene. Please do not use for peptides processed from polyproteins or proviral sequences, as these are all annotated differently.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: VMOLTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Molecule Type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of in vivo molecule sequenced. Taken from the INSDC controlled vocabulary. Example: Genomic DNA, Genomic RNA, viral cRNA.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of virus (ICTV-approved or otherwise), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Influenza, Norovirus, Sapovirus and HIV have special nomenclature. Please contact us if you are unsure. Example: Raspberry bushy dwarf virus, Influenza A virus (A/chicken/Germany/1949(H10N7)), HIV-1 M:F_CHU51.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE
FIELD.NAME: Gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Symbol of the gene corresponding to a sequence region. Example: RdRp, CP, ORF1.

FIELD.LABEL: SVCGRTABLE
FIELD.NAME: Translation table
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Translation table for this virus. Chose between standard (table 1) and mitovirus codes (table 4.). Example: 1, 4.

FIELD.LABEL: PSEUDO
FIELD.NAME: Pseudogene?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this a pseudogene with a disrupted CDS?. Example: yes or no.

FIELD.LABEL: PRODUCT
FIELD.NAME: Product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the product associated with the feature. Example: RNA dependent RNA polymerase, coat protein.

FIELD.LABEL: 5CDS
FIELD.NAME: 5' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the first base of the start codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 3CDS
FIELD.NAME: 3' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the last base of the stop codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 5PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the start codon upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: CODONSTART
FIELD.NAME: Reading Frame
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if your CDS is 5' partial as it defines the reading frame. Location of the first base of the first fully-encoded amino acid. Example: 1,2 or 3.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: GENOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Genotype name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for genotype. Example: 1a, 4j.

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: A/chicken/Germany/1949, 12535-07.

FIELD.LABEL: SEROTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Serotype name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for serotype/serovar. Example: H3N2, 2.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: SEGMENT
FIELD.NAME: Segment name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the viral segment upon which the gene is encoded. Example: RNA1, 4.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOSOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Gene Details

FIELD.LABEL: FUNCTION
FIELD.NAME: Function
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Function attributed to a sequence. Example: catalyzes the replication of RNA from an RNA template.

FIELD.LABEL: INFERTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Inference type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of non-experimental evidence that supports the feature identification. Must have the field Inference Accession selected. Example: similar to DNA sequence.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: similar to RNA sequence, other RNA

FIELD.LABEL: INFERACC
FIELD.NAME: Inference accession
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A reference to a database entry, must contain an accession and version, or an algorithm including version. Must have the field Inference Type selected. Example: FM123456.1.

FIELD.LABEL: EXPERIMENT
FIELD.NAME: Experiment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Brief description of the nature of the experimental evidence that supports the feature. Example: Northern blot.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Geographic Source

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China, Pacific Ocean.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected. Example: Cambridgeshire, Bordeaux, North Altantic Ridge.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton, Loch Ness.

FIELD.LABEL: LATLON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places). Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further Sample Data

FIELD.LABEL: COLBY
FIELD.NAME: Collector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the person or institute that originally collected the sample/organism. Example: Dan Janzen.

FIELD.LABEL: COLDATE
FIELD.NAME: Collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of collection of the original sample/organism. Example: 08-Mar-1975, Mar-1975, 1975.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Natural host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Homo sapiens, Bos taurus.

FIELD.LABEL: LABHOST
FIELD.NAME: Laboratory host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Mus musculus.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: PCR Primers

FIELD.LABEL: PFNAME1
FIELD.NAME: Forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PFSEQ1
FIELD.NAME: Forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PRNAME1
FIELD.NAME: Reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PRSEQ1
FIELD.NAME: Reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PFNAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PFSEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PRNAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PRSEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Sequence

FIELD.LABEL: SEQUENCE
FIELD.NAME: Sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequence.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: rRNA gene
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: rRNA gene
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For ribosomal RNA genes from prokaryotic, nuclear or organellar DNA. All rRNAs are considered partial.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: ENV_SAMPLE
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental/metagenomic/uncultured sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Prokaryote/fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if the rRNA gene is encoded within an intracellular structure other than the nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: SEDIMENT
FIELD.NAME: Sedimentation coefficient
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The sedimentation coefficient of the rRNA. Selectable from a controlled list. Example: 5S, 5.8S, 12S, 16S, 18S, 23S, 25S, 26S, 28S.

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATION_SOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further taxonomy

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of cultivated variety (plants only). Should not be included within the organism name. Example: Ixtapa, Maris Piper.

FIELD.LABEL: VARIETY
FIELD.NAME: Variety (varietas)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Officially recognised variety (mainly plants and fungi). Generally included in the organism name too, e.g., Amanita muscaria var. alba. Example: albiflorus, minor.

FIELD.LABEL: ECOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat. Commonly applied to Arabidopsis thaliana stocks. Example: Columbia.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: Breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of genetically-modified or artifically-selected for animal (farm animals, domesticated animals etc.). Example: Large White, Berkshire.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Repository Data

FIELD.LABEL: CULT_COLL
FIELD.NAME: Culture collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a live microbial or fungal culture or cell line in a curated culture collection see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/culture_collection.html. Example: ATCC:26370.

FIELD.LABEL: SPEC_VOUCH
FIELD.NAME: Specimen voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection. Example: freetext like 99-SRNP-2003; structured like AMCC:101706.

FIELD.LABEL: BIO_MAT
FIELD.NAME: Biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Culture Collection or Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Geographic Source

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China, Pacific Ocean.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected. Example: Cambridge, Bordeaux, North Altantic Ridge.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton, Loch Ness.

FIELD.LABEL: LAT_LON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places). Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further Sample Data

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The haplotype designation to which the sequence belongs.

FIELD.LABEL: COLDATE
FIELD.NAME: Collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of collection of the original sample/organism. Example: 08-Mar-1975, Mar-1975, 1975.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: Sex of organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of organism sequence. Example: male, female, mixed.

FIELD.LABEL: MATING_TYPE
FIELD.NAME: Mating type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mating type of prokaryotes and eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes. Example: plus, minus.

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUE
FIELD.NAME: Tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The tissue type from which the DNA was extracted. Example: liver, whole organism, blood.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Natural host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Bos taurus.

FIELD.LABEL: LAB_HOST
FIELD.NAME: Laboratory host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Mus musculus.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: PCR Primers

FIELD.LABEL: FWD_NAME1
FIELD.NAME: forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of the forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: REV_SEQ2

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Sequence

FIELD.LABEL: SEQUENCE
FIELD.NAME: sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequence.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Single CDS genomic DNA
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Single CDS genomic DNA
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For complete or partial coding sequence (CDS) derived from genomic DNA. This checklist will not accept segmented genes (i.e., with intron regions) so should be used for prokaryotic, organellar genes or for submitting a single exon.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: ENVSAM
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental/metagenomic/uncultured sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Prokaryote/fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if a sequence originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: PLASMID
FIELD.NAME: Plasmid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Plasmid from which the sequence was obtained. It's a replicon that cannot be described by /chromosome or /segment. Note that the name of a broad host range plasmid is included also in the organism name. Example: pKJK5.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE
FIELD.NAME: Gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Symbol of the gene corresponding to a sequence region. Example: RdRp, sigA, inv.

FIELD.LABEL: PRODUCT
FIELD.NAME: Product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the product associated with the feature. Example: RNA dependent RNA polymerase, sigma factor A.

FIELD.LABEL: TRANSLTABLE
FIELD.NAME: Translation table
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Translation table for this organism. Chose from a drop-down list. Example: 1, 2, 3, 5, 11.

FIELD.LABEL: 5CDS
FIELD.NAME: 5' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the first base of the start codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 3CDS
FIELD.NAME: 3' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the last base of the stop codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 5PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the start codon upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: CODONSTART
FIELD.NAME: Reading Frame
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if your CDS is 5' partial as it defines the reading frame. Location of the first base of the first fully-encoded amino acid. Example: 1,2 or 3.

FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOSOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Gene Details

FIELD.LABEL: ALLELE
FIELD.NAME: Allele
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of one particular form for the given gene. Example: inv-1, inv-2.

FIELD.LABEL: CHROMOSOME
FIELD.NAME: Chromosome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Chromosome from which the sequence was obtained. Example: 2.

FIELD.LABEL: MAP
FIELD.NAME: Map
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Genomic map position of the submitted sequence. Example: 8q12-q13.

FIELD.LABEL: FUNCTION
FIELD.NAME: Function
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Function attributed to a sequence. Example: catalyzes the replication of RNA from an RNA template.

FIELD.LABEL: INFERTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Inference type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of non-experimental evidence that supports the feature identification. Must have the field Inference Accession selected. Example: similar to DNA sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: EXPERIMENT

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Brief description of the nature of the experimental evidence that supports the feature. Example: Northern blot.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name for a combination of alleles that are linked together on the same physical chromosome. Example: Dw3 B5 Cw1 A1.

FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if the spacer region is encoded within an intracellular structure other than the nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATION_SOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site must be present for environmental samples. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Additional collection details

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China, Pacific Ocean.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: Cambridge, Bordeaux, North Altantic Ridge.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton, Loch Ness.

FIELD.LABEL: LAT_LON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places); 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E. Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Natural host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken.

FIELD.LABEL: COLDATE
FIELD.NAME: Collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of collection of the original sample/organism. Example: 08-Mar-1975, Mar-1975, 1975.

FIELD.LABEL: CULT_COLL
FIELD.NAME: Culture Collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: to annotate live microbial and fungal cultures, and cell lines that have been deposited in or obtained from curated culture collections. http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/culture_collection.html. Example: ATCC:26370.

FIELD.LABEL: SPEC_VOUCHER
FIELD.NAME: Specimen Voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to the physical specimen from which the sequence was obtained (e.g. curated museum collection). http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/specimen_voucher.html. Example: AMCC:101706.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Plant/Fungal specific

FIELD.LABEL: VARIETY
FIELD.NAME: Variety
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: variety (= varietas, a formal Linnaean rank) of organism from which sequence was derived. Use the cultivar qualifier for cultivated plant varieties, i.e., products of artificial selection.

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sequence was obtained, and is applied solely to products of artificial selection; use the variety qualifier for natural, named plant and fungal varieties.

FIELD.LABEL: ECOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Sequence

FIELD.LABEL: SEQUENCE
FIELD.NAME: Sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequence.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: MHC gene 1 exon
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: MHC gene 1 exon
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For partial MHC class I or II antigens containing one exon ONLY.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Homo sapiens,Macaca mulatta,Ovis aries.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE
FIELD.NAME: gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gene symbol corresponding to a sequence region, please choose from the list. If the appropriate symbol is not in the list please choose 'other' and specify the symbol in comments to a curator. Example: HLA-A, HLA-DPB1, Gogo-A.

FIELD.LABEL: ALLELE
FIELD.NAME: allele
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of one particular form for the given gene. Plese provide here only the specification behind the asterisk '*' symbol. Remaining info will be amended automatically from the variable 'gene'. Example: 03, 00705.

FIELD.LABEL: PSEUDO
FIELD.NAME: Pseudogene?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this allele a known pseudogene?. Example: yes or no.

FIELD.LABEL: PRODUCT
FIELD.NAME: product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the product associated with the feature. Example: MHC class I antigen.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_CDS
FIELD.NAME: 5' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a 5' complete CDS this is the position of the first base of the start codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_CDS
FIELD.NAME: 3' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a 3' complete CDS this is the position of the last base of the stop codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: CDS partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the start codon upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: CDS partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: CODONSTART
FIELD.NAME: Reading Frame
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if your CDS is 5' partial as it defines the reading frame. Location of the first base of the first fully-encoded amino acid. Example: 1, 2 or 3.

FIELD.LABEL: EXON_NUMBER_A
FIELD.NAME: exon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of the sequenced exon relative to the whole MHC gene. Example: 2.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_EXON_A
FIELD.NAME: 5' exon location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the exon region relative to the submitted sequence. If the exon boundary is upstream, please use 1.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_EXON_A
FIELD.NAME: 3' exon location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the exon region relative to the submitted sequence. If the exon boundary is downstream, please use the last base in your sequence.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Chromosome-related details

FIELD.LABEL: CHROMOSOME
FIELD.NAME: chromosome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Chromosome from which the sequence was obtained. Example: 6.

FIELD.LABEL: MAP
FIELD.NAME: map
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Genomic map position of the submitted sequence. Example: 8q12-q13.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name for a combination of alleles that are linked together on the same physical chromosome. Example: Dw3 B5 Cw1 A1.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further sample data

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of genetically-modified or artifically-selected for animal. Example: Barbado, Large White.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: sex of organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of organism sequenced. Example: male, female.

FIELD.LABEL: CELL_LINE
FIELD.NAME: cell line name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for cell line. Example: 4064.

FIELD.LABEL: CELL_TYPE
FIELD.NAME: cell type name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for cell type. Example: B-lymphocytes.

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUE
FIELD.NAME: tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The tissue type from which the DNA was extracted. Example: peripheral blood.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: SPEC_VOUCH
FIELD.NAME: specimen voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection. Example: freetext, e.g. 99-SRNP-2003 or structured text, e.g. AMCC:101706.

FIELD.LABEL: BIO_MAT
FIELD.NAME: biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext, e.g. AB12345 or structured text, e.g. CGC:CB3912.

Influenza, Norovirus, Sapovirus and HIV have special nomenclature. Please contact us if you are unsure. Example: Norovirus Hu/GI.1/2003/4602/Moscow/RUS, HIV-1 M:F_CHU51.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name(s) of the mature peptides encoded within the sequenced region. Example: protease and reverse transcriptase.

FIELD.NAME: Organism

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The haplotype designation to which these sequence belongs.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14.

FIELD.LABEL: DEVSTAGE
FIELD.NAME: Development stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Developmental stage of the organism, either a named stage, or a measurement of time. Example: fourth instar larva, 3 day old, blastula.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONELIB
FIELD.NAME: Clone library name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the clone library that has been sequenced. Example: lowlight3, lib1.

FIELD.LABEL: CELLTYPE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cell type (in a multicellular organism) from which sequence was generated. Example: CD4+ lymphocyte, palisade cell.

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUETYPE
FIELD.NAME: Tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tissue type from which sequence was generated. Example: liver, root, fruiting body.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The recognised breed name of the organism, please use cultivar or variety for plants/fungi. Example: Bull terrier, Friesian Holstein, Large white.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: Sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sex of the organism from which the sequence was obtained; sex is used for eukaryotic organisms that undergo meiosis and have sexually dimorphic gametes. Example: male, dioecious.

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sequence was obtained, and is applied solely to products of artificial selection; use the variety qualifier for natural, named plant and fungal varieties.

FIELD.LABEL: ECOTYPE

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Nicotiana tabacum, Iris caucasica subsp. turcica, Aster indicus var. pinnatifidus.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_CDS
FIELD.NAME: 5' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the matK coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the first base of the start codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_CDS
FIELD.NAME: 3' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the matK coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the last base of the stop codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: CDS partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the start codon upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: CDS partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: CODONSTART
FIELD.NAME: Reading Frame
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if your CDS is 5' partial as it defines the reading frame. Location of the first base of the first fully-encoded amino acid. Example: 1,2 or 3.

FIELD.LABEL: INTRON
FIELD.NAME: trnK intron present?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For 5' or 3' flanking region of the trnK gene intron being present in the submitted sequence.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Single CDS mRNA
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Single CDS mRNA
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For complete or partial single coding sequence (CDS) derived from mRNA (via cDNA). Do NOT use for submission of VIRTUAL transcripts (TSA or Unigene clusters) - use TSA CDS Annotated checklist.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Fundamental information

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: ENVSAM
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental/metagenomic/uncultured sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Prokaryote/fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if a sequence originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: PLASMID
FIELD.NAME: Plasmid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Plasmid from which the sequence was obtained. It's a replicon that cannot be described by /chromosome or /segment. Note that the name of a broad host range plasmid is included also in the organism name. Example: pKJK5.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE
FIELD.NAME: Gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Symbol of the gene corresponding to a sequence region. Example: RdRp, sigA, inv.

FIELD.LABEL: PRODUCT
FIELD.NAME: Product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the product associated with the feature. Example: RNA dependent RNA polymerase, sigma factor A.

FIELD.LABEL: FUNCTION
FIELD.NAME: Function
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Function attributed to a sequence. Example: catalyzes the replication of RNA from an RNA template.

FIELD.LABEL: 5CDS
FIELD.NAME: 5' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the first base of the start codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 3CDS
FIELD.NAME: 3' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length CDS this is the position of the last base of the stop codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 5PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the start codon upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: CODONSTART
FIELD.NAME: Reading Frame
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if your CDS is 5' partial as it defines the reading frame. Location of the first base of the first fully-encoded amino acid. Example: 1,2 or 3.

FIELD.LABEL: TRANSLTABLE
FIELD.NAME: Translation table
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Translation table for this organism. Chose from a drop-down list. Example: 1, 2, 3, 5, 11.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: mRNA-specific feature locations

FIELD.LABEL: 5UTRSTART
FIELD.NAME: 5' UTR start location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the 5'UTR region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 5UTREND
FIELD.NAME: 5' UTR end location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the 5'UTR region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3UTRSTART
FIELD.NAME: 3' UTR start location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the 3'UTR region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3UTREND
FIELD.NAME: 3' UTR end location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the 3'UTR region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: POLYASIGSTART
FIELD.NAME: PolyA signal start location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the recognition region necessary for endonuclease cleavage of an RNA transcript. For example, the location of the first A in the AATAAA consensus sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: POLYASIGEND
FIELD.NAME: PolyA signal end location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the recognition region necessary for endonuclease cleavage of an RNA transcript. For example, the location of the last A in the AATAAA consensus sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: POLYASITE
FIELD.NAME: PolyA tail start position
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Highly recommended- please avoid clipping your sequences. Location to which adenine residues are added (post-transcriptional polyadenylation.).

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Culture Collection or Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: PCR Primers

FIELD.LABEL: PFNAME1
FIELD.NAME: Forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PFSEQ1
FIELD.NAME: Forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PRNAME1
FIELD.NAME: Reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PRSEQ1
FIELD.NAME: Reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PFNAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PFSEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PRNAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PRSEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Supporting evidence

FIELD.LABEL: INFERTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Inference type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of non-experimental evidence that supports the feature identification. Must have the field Inference Accession selected. Example: similar to DNA sequence.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: similar to RNA sequence, other RNA

FIELD.LABEL: INFERACC
FIELD.NAME: Inference accession
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A reference to a database entry, must contain an accession and version, or an algorithm including version. Must have Inference Type selected. Example: FM123456.1.

FIELD.LABEL: EXPERIMENT
FIELD.NAME: Experiment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Brief description of the nature of the experimental evidence that supports the feature. Example: Northern blot.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Sequence

FIELD.LABEL: SEQUENCE
FIELD.NAME: Sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequence.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Intergenic Spacer, IGS
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Intergenic Spacer, IGS
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For intergenic spacer (IGS) sequences between neighbouring genes (e.g., psbA-trnH IGS, 16S-23S rRNA IGS). Inclusion of the flanking genes is allowed.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: ENV_SAMPLE
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental; metagenomic or uncultured prokaryotic/fungal sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Prokaryote/fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The haplotype designation to which these sequence belongs.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE1
FIELD.NAME: 5' Gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The 5prime upstream gene symbol. Example: psbA.

FIELD.LABEL: G1PRESENT
FIELD.NAME: Is the 5prime upstream gene present in the sequence?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: yes if any part of the upstream gene is present in the sequence. Example: yes or no.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE2
FIELD.NAME: 3' Gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The 3prime downstream gene symbol. Example: trnH.

FIELD.LABEL: G2PRESENT
FIELD.NAME: Is the 3prime downstream gene present in the sequence?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: yes if any part of the downstream gene is present in the sequence. Example: yes or no.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if a sequence originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATION_SOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further taxonomy

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of cultivated variety (plants only). Should not be included within the organism name. Example: Ixtapa, Maris Piper.

FIELD.LABEL: VARIETY
FIELD.NAME: Variety (varietas)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Officially recognised variety (mainly plants and fungi). Generally included in the organism name too, e.g., Amanita muscaria var. alba. Example: albiflorus, minor.

FIELD.LABEL: ECOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat. Commonly applied to Arabidopsis thaliana stocks. Example: Columbia.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: Breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of genetically-modified or artifically-selected for animal (farm animals, domesticated animals etc.). Example: Large White, Berkshire.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Repository Data

FIELD.LABEL: CULT_COLL
FIELD.NAME: Culture collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a live microbial or fungal culture or cell line in a curated culture collection see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/culture_collection.html. Example: ATCC:26370.

FIELD.LABEL: SPEC_VOUCH
FIELD.NAME: Specimen voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection. Example: freetext like 99-SRNP-2003; structured like AMCC:101706.

FIELD.LABEL: BIO_MAT
FIELD.NAME: Biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Culture Collection or Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Geographic Source

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China, Pacific Ocean.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected. Example: Cambridge, Bordeaux, North Altantic Ridge.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton, Loch Ness.

FIELD.LABEL: LAT_LON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places). Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further Sample Data

FIELD.LABEL: COLDATE
FIELD.NAME: Collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of collection of the original sample/organism. Example: 08-Mar-1975, Mar-1975, 1975.

FIELD.LABEL: COL_BY
FIELD.NAME: Collected by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Collector(s) of the sample.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: Sex of organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of organism sequence. Example: male, female, mixed.

FIELD.LABEL: MATING_TYPE
FIELD.NAME: Mating type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mating type of prokaryotes and eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes. Example: plus, minus.

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUE
FIELD.NAME: Tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The tissue type from which the DNA was extracted. Example: liver, whole organism, blood.

FIELD.LABEL: DEV_STAGE
FIELD.NAME: Development stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Developmental stage of the organism, either a named stage, or a measurement of time. Example: fourth instar larva, 3 day old, blastula.

FIELD.LABEL: CELL_TYPE
FIELD.NAME: Cell type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cell type (in a multicellular organism) from which sequence was generated. Example: CD4+ lymphocyte, palisade cell.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Natural host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Bos taurus.

FIELD.LABEL: LAB_HOST
FIELD.NAME: Laboratory host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Mus musculus.

FIELD_GROUP.NAME: PCR primers

FIELD.LABEL: FWD_SEQ1
FIELD.NAME: forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: REV_NAME1
FIELD.NAME: reverse primer name

FIELD.LABEL: REV_SEQ1
FIELD.NAME: reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Sequence

FIELD.LABEL: SEQUENCE
FIELD.NAME: Sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nucleotide sequence that has been generated.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Mobile Element
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Mobile Element
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For the submission of a single complete or partial mobile element. This checklist captures the mobile element feature but does not allow for granular annotation of component parts, such as coding regions, repeat regions and miscellaneous features within the mobile element itself. If precise annotation or translation is required, please use an alternative submission route.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: ENVSAM
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental/metagenomic/uncultured sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Prokaryote/fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if a sequence originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The haplotype designation to which the sequence belongs.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: MOBTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Mobile element type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The class of mobile element, taken from the INSDC controlled vocabulary. Example: transposon, LINE.

FIELD.LABEL: MOBNAME
FIELD.NAME: Mobile element name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name or identifier of the submitted mobile element. This can be a lab name. Example: Tnp9. LINE-1 beta5.

FIELD.LABEL: REPFAM
FIELD.NAME: Mobile element family
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the mobile element comes from a known family, please provide this here. Example: Alu, LINE-2.

FIELD.LABEL: MOBNOTES
FIELD.NAME: Mobile element notes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any brief notes relevant to the submitted mobile element (not intended for the family.). Example: full-length active copy, 5' truncated.

FIELD.LABEL: 5MOB
FIELD.NAME: 5' Mobile element location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the mobile element within the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3MOB
FIELD.NAME: 3' Mobile element location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the mobile element within the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 5PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Is mobile element partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Yes for a 5'-incomplete mobile element.

FIELD.LABEL: 3PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Is mobile element partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Yes for a 3'-incomplete mobile element.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: MHC gene 2 exons
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: MHC gene 2 exons
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For partial MHC class I or II antigens containing two exons ONLY. An intron feature should only be used when the intron region has actually been sequenced. If the intron has not been sequenced, or only partially sequenced, please fill the non-sequenced gap with 100 Ns.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Homo sapiens,Macaca mulatta,Ovis aries.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE
FIELD.NAME: gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gene symbol corresponding to a sequence region, please choose from the list. If the appropriate symbol is not in the list please choose 'other' and specify the symbol in comments to a curator. Example: HLA-A, HLA-DPB1, Gogo-A.

FIELD.LABEL: ALLELE
FIELD.NAME: allele
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of one particular form for the given gene. Plese provide here only the specification behind the asterisk '*' symbol. Remaining info will be amended automatically from the variable 'gene'. Example: 03, 00705.

FIELD.LABEL: PSEUDO
FIELD.NAME: Pseudogene?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this allele a known pseudogene?. Example: yes or no.

FIELD.LABEL: PRODUCT
FIELD.NAME: product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the product associated with the feature. Example: MHC class I antigen.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_CDS
FIELD.NAME: 5' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a 5' complete CDS this is the position of the first base of the start codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_CDS
FIELD.NAME: 3' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the coding region relative to the submitted sequence. For a 3' complete CDS this is the position of the last base of the stop codon.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: CDS partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the start codon upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: CDS partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: CODONSTART
FIELD.NAME: Reading Frame
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if your CDS is 5' partial as it defines the reading frame. Location of the first base of the first fully-encoded amino acid. Example: 1, 2 or 3.

FIELD.LABEL: EXON_NUMBER_A
FIELD.NAME: exon_A
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of the sequenced exon_A relative to the whole MHC gene. Example: 2.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_EXON_A
FIELD.NAME: 5' exon_A location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the exon_A region relative to the submitted sequence. If the exon boundary is upstream, please use 1.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_EXON_A
FIELD.NAME: 3' exon_A location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the exon_A region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: EXON_NUMBER_B
FIELD.NAME: exon_B
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Number of the sequenced exon_B relative to the whole MHC gene. Example: 3.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_EXON_B
FIELD.NAME: 5' exon_B location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the exon_B region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_EXON_B
FIELD.NAME: 3' exon_B location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the exon_B region relative to the submitted sequence. If the exon boundary is downstream, please use the last base in your sequence.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Intron details

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_INTRON
FIELD.NAME: 5' intron location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the sequenced intron region relative to the submitted sequence. If the intron region has not been sequenced please do NOT include this feature. Please insert 100 times 'n' in the sequence where the intron is expected. Gap features will be amended automatically.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_INTRON
FIELD.NAME: 3' intron location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the sequenced intron region relative to the submitted sequence. If the intron region has not been sequenced please do NOT include this feature. Please insert 100 times 'n' in the sequence where the intron is expected. Gap features will be amended automatically.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Chromosome-related details

FIELD.LABEL: CHROMOSOME
FIELD.NAME: chromosome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Chromosome from which the sequence was obtained. Example: 6.

FIELD.LABEL: MAP
FIELD.NAME: map
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Genomic map position of the submitted sequence. Example: 8q12-q13.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name for a combination of alleles that are linked together on the same physical chromosome. Example: Dw3 B5 Cw1 A1.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further sample data

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of genetically-modified or artifically-selected for animal. Example: Barbado, Large White.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: sex of organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of organism sequenced. Example: male, female.

FIELD.LABEL: CELL_LINE
FIELD.NAME: cell line name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for cell line. Example: 4064.

FIELD.LABEL: CELL_TYPE
FIELD.NAME: cell type name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for cell type. Example: B-lymphocytes.

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUE
FIELD.NAME: tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The tissue type from which the DNA was extracted. Example: peripheral blood.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: SPEC_VOUCH
FIELD.NAME: specimen voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection. Example: freetext like 99-SRNP-2003; structured like AMCC:101706.

FIELD.LABEL: BIO_MAT
FIELD.NAME: biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: PCR Primers

FIELD.LABEL: FWD_NAME1
FIELD.NAME: forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: FWD_SEQ1
FIELD.NAME: forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: REV_NAME1
FIELD.NAME: reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: REV_SEQ1
FIELD.NAME: reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: FWD_NAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: FWD_SEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: REV_NAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: REV_SEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Supporting evidence

FIELD.LABEL: INFERTYPE
FIELD.NAME: inference type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of non-experimental evidence that supports the feature identification. Must have the field 'Inference Accession' selected. Example: similar to DNA sequence.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: similar to RNA sequence, other RNA

FIELD.LABEL: INFER_ACC
FIELD.NAME: inference accession
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A reference to a database entry, must contain an accession and version, or an algorithm including version. Must have the field 'Inference Type' selected. Example: FM123456.1.

FIELD.LABEL: EXPERIMENT
FIELD.NAME: experiment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Brief description of the nature of the experimental evidence that supports the feature. Example: Northern blot.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Sequence

FIELD.LABEL: SEQUENCE
FIELD.NAME: Sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequence.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Alphasatellite sub-viral particle
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Alphasatellite sub-viral particle
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For submission of circular single stranded DNA alphasatellite sequences associated with Begomovirus, Babuvirus and Nanovirus.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of sub-viral particle (ICTV-approved or otherwise), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Example: Ageratum yellow vein alphasatellite.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample/alphasatellite that has been sequenced. Example: Pakistan-5.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Plant host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The plant from which the sequenced alphasatellite was taken. Cultivar can be included with the scientific name. Example: Nicotiana benthamiana.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOSOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical source of sample, usually host leaf. Example: host plant leaves.

FIELD.LABEL: 5CDS
FIELD.NAME: Rep start coordinate within sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start position (first base of start codon) of the Rep ORF within the sequence. Example: 57.

FIELD.LABEL: 3CDS
FIELD.NAME: Rep end coordinate within sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End position (last base of stop codon) of the Rep ORF within the sequence. Example: 944.

FIELD.LABEL: PSEUDO
FIELD.NAME: Truncated/Nonfunctional Rep copy?
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is the Rep gene defective due to truncation or mutation?. Example: yes or no.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Geographic Source

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected. Example: Cambridgeshire, Bordeaux.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton.

FIELD.LABEL: LATLON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places.). Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further Sample Data

FIELD.LABEL: COLDATE
FIELD.NAME: Collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of collection of the original sample/organism. Example: 08-Mar-1975, Mar-1975, 1975.

FIELD.LABEL: COLBY
FIELD.NAME: Collector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the person or institute that originally collected the sample/organism. Example: Dan Janzen.

FIELD.LABEL: PRSEQ1

FIELD.NAME: Sequence

DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Gene intron

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Bos taurus, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

FIELD.LABEL: ENV_SAMPLE
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental/uncultured sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if a sequence originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE
FIELD.NAME: Gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Symbol of the gene corresponding to a sequence region. Example: RdRp, sigA, inv.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: intron partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete intron with the start upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: intron partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete intron with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_INTRON
FIELD.NAME: 5' intron location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the intron region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length intron this is the position of the first base of the intron.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_INTRON
FIELD.NAME: 3' intron location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the intron region relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length intron this is the position of the last base of the intron.

FIELD.LABEL: NUMBER
FIELD.NAME: intron number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The intron number relative to the whole gene. Example: 2.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATION_SOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: river bank, skin of Vitis vinifera fruit.

FIELD.LABEL: PLASMID
FIELD.NAME: plasmid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Plasmid from which the sequence was obtained. It's a replicon that cannot be described by /chromosome or /segment. Example: pKJK5.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Gene Details

FIELD.LABEL: ALLELE
FIELD.NAME: Allele
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of one particular form for the given gene. Example: inv-1, inv-2.

FIELD.LABEL: CHROMOSOME
FIELD.NAME: Chromosome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Chromosome from which the sequence was obtained. Example: 2.

FIELD.LABEL: MAP
FIELD.NAME: map
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Genomic map position of the submitted sequence. Example: 8q12-q13.

FIELD.LABEL: INFERTYPE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of non-experimental evidence that supports the feature identification. Must have the field Inference Accession selected. Example: similar to DNA sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name for a combination of alleles that are linked together on the same physical chromosome. Example: Dw3 B5 Cw1 A1.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further taxonomy

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of cultivated variety (plants only). Should not be included within the organism name. Example: Ixtapa, Maris Piper.

FIELD.LABEL: VARIETY
FIELD.NAME: Variety (varietas)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Officially recognised variety (mainly plants and fungi) approved by the Botanical Code. Generally included in the organism name too, e.g., Amanita muscaria var. alba. Example: albiflorus, minor.

FIELD.LABEL: ECOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat. Commonly applied to Arabidopsis thaliana stocks. Example: Columbia.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: Breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of genetically-modified or artifically-selected for animal (farm animals, domesticated animals etc.). Example: Large White, Berkshire.

FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Repository Data

FIELD.LABEL: CULT_COLL
FIELD.NAME: Culture collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a live fungal culture or cell line in a curated culture collection see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/culture_collection.html. Example: ATCC:26370.

FIELD.LABEL: SPEC_VOUCH
FIELD.NAME: Specimen voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection. Example: freetext like 99-SRNP-2003; structured like AMCC:101706.

FIELD.LABEL: BIO_MAT
FIELD.NAME: Biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Culture Collection or Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912.

DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For the submission of multi-locus markers (e.g., tRNA + CDS + rRNA) from in vivo gemomic DNA. This checklist provides a simple submission process for organellar or nuclear regions containing multiple genes. For example, a region containing coding genes, rRNA genes and tRNA genes. Please note that individual feature annotation is not possible with this checklist.

FIELD.NAME: Sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nucleotide sequence that has been generated.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Phylogenetic Marker
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Phylogenetic Marker
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For the submission of the following markers: actin (act), tubulin (tuba or tubb), calmodulin (CaM), RNA polymerase II large subunits (RPB1 and RPB2), translation elongation factor 1-alpha (tef1a), glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) and histone 3 (H3) where the intron/exon boundaries are not known.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The haplotype designation to which these sequence belongs.

FIELD.LABEL: MARKER
FIELD.NAME: Marker Product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The phylogenetic marker gene product. Example: actin, alpha tubulin, beta tubulin, calmodulin, translation elongation factor 1-alpha.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOSOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if a sequence originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further taxonomy

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of cultivated variety (plants only). Should not be included within the organism name. Example: Ixtapa, Maris Piper.

FIELD.LABEL: VARIETY
FIELD.NAME: Variety (varietas)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Officially recognised variety (mainly plants and fungi). Generally included in the organism name too, e.g., Amanita muscaria var. alba. Example: albiflorus, minor.

FIELD.LABEL: ECOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat. Commonly applied to Arabidopsis thaliana stocks. Example: Columbia.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: Breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of genetically-modified or artifically-selected for animal (farm animals, domesticated animals etc.). Example: Large White, Berkshire.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Repository Data

FIELD.LABEL: CULTCOLL
FIELD.NAME: Culture collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a live microbial or fungal culture or cell line in a curated culture collection see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/culture_collection.html. Example: ATCC:26370.

FIELD.LABEL: SPECVOUCH
FIELD.NAME: Specimen voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection. Example: freetext like 99-SRNP-2003; structured like AMCC:101706.

FIELD.LABEL: BIOMAT
FIELD.NAME: Biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Culture Collection or Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Geographic Source

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China, Pacific Ocean.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected. Example: Cambridge, Bordeaux, North Altantic Ridge.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton, Loch Ness.

FIELD.LABEL: LATLON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees. Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD.LABEL: COLBY
FIELD.NAME: Collected by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Collector(s) of the sample.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: Sex of organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of organism sequence. Example: male, female, mixed.

FIELD.LABEL: MATINGTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Mating type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mating type of prokaryotes and eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes. Example: plus, minus.

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUE
FIELD.NAME: Tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The tissue type from which the DNA was extracted. Example: liver, whole organism, blood.

FIELD.LABEL: DEVSTAGE
FIELD.NAME: Development stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Developmental stage of the organism, either a named stage, or a measurement of time. Example: fourth instar larva, 3 day old, blastula.

FIELD.LABEL: CELLTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Cell type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cell type (in a multicellular organism) from which sequence was generated. Example: CD4+ lymphocyte, palisade cell.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Natural host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Bos taurus.

FIELD.LABEL: LABHOST
FIELD.NAME: Laboratory host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Mus musculus.

FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14.

FIELD.LABEL: HAPLOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Haplotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name for a combination of alleles that are linked together on the same physical chromosome. Example: Dw3 B5 Cw1 A1.

FIELD.LABEL: DEVSTAGE
FIELD.NAME: Development stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Developmental stage of the organism, either a named stage, or a measurement of time. Example: fourth instar larva, 3 day old, blastula.

FIELD.LABEL: CELLTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Cell type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cell type (in a multicellular organism) from which sequence was generated. Example: CD4+ lymphocyte, palisade cell.

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUETYPE
FIELD.NAME: Tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tissue type from which sequence was generated. Example: liver, root, fruiting body.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: Breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The recognised breed name of the organism, please use cultivar or variety for plants/fungi. Example: Bull terrier, Friesian Holstein, Large white.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: Sex
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: sex of the organism from which the sequence was obtained; sex is used for eukaryotic organisms that undergo meiosis and have sexually dimorphic gametes. Example: male, dioecious.

FIELD.LABEL: SPECVOUCH
FIELD.NAME: Specimen Voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to the physical specimen from which the sequence was obtained (e.g. curated museum collection). http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/specimen_voucher.html. Example: AMCC:101706.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: CDS details

FIELD.LABEL: 5CDS
FIELD.NAME: 5' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location of the first base of the start codon, if not present please provide location of first base involved in forming a codon (1 for 5' partial.). Example: 20, 1.

FIELD.LABEL: 3CDS
FIELD.NAME: 3' CDS location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: location of the last base of the stop codon, if not present please provide location of last base involved in forming a codon (last base in sequence where 3' partial.). Example: 680.

FIELD.LABEL: 5PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the start codon upstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For an incomplete CDS with the stop codon downstream of the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: CODONSTART
FIELD.NAME: Reading Frame
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if your CDS is 5' partial as it defines the reading frame. Location of the first base of the first fully-encoded amino acid. Example: 1,2 or 3.

FIELD.LABEL: COITABLE
FIELD.NAME: Translation table
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mitochondrial translation table for this organism. Chose between Vertebrate (table 2), Mold-Protozoan-Coelenterate (table 4) and Invertebrate codes (table 5). Example: 2, 4, 5.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: variety (= varietas, a formal Linnaean rank) of organism from which sequence was derived. Use the cultivar qualifier for cultivated plant varieties, i.e., products of artificial selection.

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sequence was obtained, and is applied solely to products of artificial selection; use the variety qualifier for natural, named plant and fungal varieties.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Satellite DNA
