FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus suber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: ENV_SAMPLE
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental/metagenomic/uncultured sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Prokaryote/fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: SATELLITETYPE
FIELD.NAME: Type of satellite DNA
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of satellite DNA being submitted (satellite, microsatellite or minisatellite). Example: satellite, microsatellite, minisatellite.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if a sequence originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: PLASMID
FIELD.NAME: Plasmid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Plasmid from which the sequence was obtained. It's a replicon that cannot be described by /chromosome or /segment. Note that the name of a broad host range plasmid is included also in the organism name. Example: pKJK5.

FIELD.LABEL: SEGMENT
FIELD.NAME: Segment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of viral or phage segment sequenced. Example: 5.

FIELD.LABEL: RPT_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Satellite identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name fof the satellite locus (often the clone name). Example: AG9-164, ccmp2.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_RPT
FIELD.NAME: 5' satellite location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the satellite repeat region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_RPT
FIELD.NAME: 3' satellite location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the satellite repeat region relative to the submitted sequence.

FIELD.LABEL: 5'_RPT_UNIT
FIELD.NAME: 5' repeat unit location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the satellite repeat unit relative to the submitted sequence. Microsatellite repeats can be better described in the 'repeat sequence' field.

FIELD.LABEL: 3'_RPT_UNIT
FIELD.NAME: 3' repeat unit location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the satellite repeat unit relative to the submitted sequence. Microsatellite repeats can be better described in the 'repeat sequence' field.

FIELD.LABEL: RPT_SEQ
FIELD.NAME: repeat sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Nucleotide sequence repeated in the satellite. Satellite and Minisatellite repeats can be better described with repeat unit locations. Example: aagggc.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Viral Untranslated Region (UTR)
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Viral Untranslated Region (UTR)
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For complete or partial untranslated region (UTR) or nontranslated region (NTR) found at the termini of viral genomes. Please do not use this checklist for submitting virus genomes or viral coding genes.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields and Questions

FIELD.LABEL: VMOLTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Molecule Type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of in vivo molecule sequenced. Taken from the INSDC controlled vocabulary. Example: Genomic DNA, Genomic RNA, viral cRNA.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of virus (ICTV-approved or otherwise), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Influenza, Norovirus, Sapovirus and HIV have special nomenclature. Please contact us if you are unsure. Example: Raspberry bushy dwarf virus, Influenza A virus (A/chicken/Germany/1949(H10N7)), HIV-1 M:F_CHU51.

FIELD.LABEL: UTRTYPE
FIELD.NAME: UTR type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The terminal type of UTR/NTR. Example: 5'UTR, 3'UTR.

FIELD.LABEL: 5UTR
FIELD.NAME: UTR start
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: First base of submitted sequence involved in the UTR. Example: 1.

FIELD.LABEL: 3UTR
FIELD.NAME: UTR stop
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Last base of submitted sequence involved in the UTR. Example: 400.

FIELD.LABEL: 5PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 5' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the UTR is known to be partial at the 5' end, please state yes.

FIELD.LABEL: 3PARTIAL
FIELD.NAME: Partial at 3' ? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If the UTR is known to be partial at the 3' end, please state yes.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: GENOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Genotype name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for genotype. Example: 1a, 4j.

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: A/chicken/Germany/1949, 12535-07.

FIELD.LABEL: SEROTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Serotype name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier of the genotype class. Example: H3N2, 2.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: SEGMENT
FIELD.NAME: Segment name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the viral segment upon which the submitted sequence is found. Example: RNA1, 4.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Geographic Source

FIELD.LABEL: ISOSOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China, Pacific Ocean.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected. Example: Cambridgeshire, Bordeaux, North Altantic Ridge.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton, Loch Ness.

FIELD.LABEL: LATLON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places.). Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further Sample Data

FIELD.LABEL: COLDATE
FIELD.NAME: Collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of collection of the original sample/organism. Example: 08-Mar-1975, Mar-1975, 1975.

FIELD.LABEL: COLBY
FIELD.NAME: Collected by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Collector(s) of the sample.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Natural host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Homo sapiens, Bos taurus.

FIELD.LABEL: LABHOST
FIELD.NAME: Laboratory host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Mus musculus.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: PCR Primers

FIELD.LABEL: PFNAME1
FIELD.NAME: Forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PFSEQ1
FIELD.NAME: Forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PRNAME1
FIELD.NAME: Reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PRSEQ1
FIELD.NAME: Reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PFNAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd forward direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PFSEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd forward primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD.LABEL: PRNAME2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the 2nd reverse direction PCR primer.

FIELD.LABEL: PRSEQ2
FIELD.NAME: 2nd reverse primer sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequences should be given in the IUPAC degenerate-base alphabet, except for the modified bases; those must be enclosed within angle brackets.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Sequence

FIELD.LABEL: SEQUENCE
FIELD.NAME: Sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sequence.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: ncRNA
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: ncRNA
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For non-coding RNA (ncRNA) transcripts or single-exon genes of prokaryotic or eukaryotic origin with the exception of the ribosomal RNA (rRNA) and transfer RNA (tRNA.)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Mandatory Fields

FIELD.LABEL: NCRMOLTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Sequenced molecule
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The in vivo molecule which has been sequenced. Example: genomic DNA, transcribed RNA.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Bacillus sp. 654g14, Quercus ruber, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Treponema pallidum subsp. pallidum.

FIELD.LABEL: ENVSAM
FIELD.NAME: Is your organism from an environmental/metagenomic/uncultured sample? (yes/no)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Environmental samples are those which are derived from direct sequencing of a bulk anonymous sample. Prokaryote/fungi from environmental samples are not culturable and so cannot be identified morphologically. Such organisms are prefixed with the term uncultured. Example: If yes, isolation source information is mandatory.

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANELLE
FIELD.NAME: Organelle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mandatory if any sequence in the submission originates from an intracellular structure other than nucleus. Example: mitochondrion, chloroplast, plastid.

FIELD.LABEL: NCRNACLASS
FIELD.NAME: ncRNA class
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A class of the ncRNA. Selectable from the INSDC controlled vocabulary for ncRNA classes. Example: miRNA, snoRNA, guide_RNA.

FIELD.LABEL: NCRNASTART
FIELD.NAME: 5' ncRNA location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Start of the non-coding RNA relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length ncRNA this is the position of the first base of the non-coding RNA.

FIELD.LABEL: NCRNAEND
FIELD.NAME: 3' ncRNA location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: End of the non-coding RNA relative to the submitted sequence. For a full length ncRNA this is the position of the last base of the non-coding RNA.

FIELD.LABEL: GENE
FIELD.NAME: Gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Symbol of the gene, putative or official. Example: miR-126.

FIELD.LABEL: PRODUCT
FIELD.NAME: Product
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the ncRNA product. Example: microRNA miR-126-5p.

FIELD.LABEL: NOTE
FIELD.NAME: Note
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This field is mandatory if your ncRNA does not fall into one of the INSCDC ncRNA classes (see: http://www.insdc.org/rna_vocab.html). Please provide a brief description of the novel ncRNA class.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Basic Details

FIELD.LABEL: STRAIN
FIELD.NAME: Strain name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name or identifier for strain, typically a collection prefix followed by a number. This is NOT the organism name. Example: DSM 5432, BALB/c.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE
FIELD.NAME: Clone identifier
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE
FIELD.NAME: Isolate name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample or environmental isolate that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14, individual 5.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOSOURCE
FIELD.NAME: Isolation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, microbial mat.

FIELD.LABEL: CHROMOSOME
FIELD.NAME: Chromosome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Chromosome from which the sequence was obtained. Example: 6.

FIELD.LABEL: MAP
FIELD.NAME: Map
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Genomic map position of the submitted sequence. Example: 8q12-q13.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further taxonomy

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR
FIELD.NAME: Cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of cultivated variety (plants only). Should not be included within the organism name. Example: Ixtapa, Maris Piper.

FIELD.LABEL: VARIETY
FIELD.NAME: Variety (varietas)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Officially recognised variety (mainly plants and fungi). Generally included in the organism name too, e.g., Amanita muscaria var. alba. Example: albiflorus, minor.

FIELD.LABEL: ECOTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Ecotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat. Commonly applied to Arabidopsis thaliana stocks. Example: Columbia.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED
FIELD.NAME: Breed
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of genetically-modified or artifically-selected for animal (farm animals, domesticated animals etc.). Example: Large White, Berkshire.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Repository Data

FIELD.LABEL: CULTCOLL
FIELD.NAME: Culture collection
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a live microbial or fungal culture or cell line in a curated culture collection see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ena/WebFeat/qualifiers/culture_collection.html. Example: ATCC:26370.

FIELD.LABEL: SPECVOUCH
FIELD.NAME: Specimen voucher
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a physical specimen from a curated or lab herbarium, museum or tissue collection. Example: freetext like 99-SRNP-2003; structured like AMCC:101706.

FIELD.LABEL: BIOMAT
FIELD.NAME: Biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to a living specimen or direct DNA sample from zoos, aquaria, stock centres, seed banks, germplasm repositories and DNA banks. Use where Culture Collection or Specimen Voucher are not appropriate. Example: freetext like AB12345; structured like CGC:CB3912.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Geographic Source

FIELD.LABEL: COUNTRY
FIELD.NAME: Country
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Example: France, China, Pacific Ocean.

FIELD.LABEL: AREA
FIELD.NAME: Geographic area
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Political name of the area of country or ocean in which sequenced sample or isolate was collected. Must have Country selected. Example: Cambridge, Bordeaux, North Altantic Ridge.

FIELD.LABEL: LOCALITY
FIELD.NAME: Locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: More geographic-specific location where sequenced material was sourced. Must have Country AND Geographic area selected. Example: York, Colton, Loch Ness.

FIELD.LABEL: LATLON
FIELD.NAME: Latitude/Longitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places.). Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Further Sample Data

FIELD.LABEL: TISSUE
FIELD.NAME: Tissue type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The tissue type from which the DNA was extracted. Example: liver, whole organism, blood.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: Sex of organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of organism sequence. Example: male, female, mixed.

FIELD.LABEL: SEROTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Serotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Serological variety of a species characterized by its antigenic properties. Example: B1.

FIELD.LABEL: MATTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Mating type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mating type of prokaryotes and eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes. Example: plus, minus.

FIELD.LABEL: HOST
FIELD.NAME: Natural host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The natural host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Bos taurus.

FIELD.LABEL: LABHOST
FIELD.NAME: Laboratory host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The laboratory host of the organism from which the sequenced material was taken. Example: Mus musculus.

FIELD.LABEL: COLDATE
FIELD.NAME: Collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of collection of the original sample/organism. Example: 08-Mar-1975, Mar-1975, 1975.

FIELD.LABEL: COLBY
FIELD.NAME: Collected by
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Collector(s) of the sample.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Supporting evidence

FIELD.LABEL: FUNCTION
FIELD.NAME: Function
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Function attributed to a sequence. Example: involved in modification and processing of ribosomal RNA or transfer RNA.

FIELD.LABEL: INFERTYPE
FIELD.NAME: Inference type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of non-experimental evidence that supports the feature identification. Must have the field Inference Accession selected. Example: similar to DNA sequence.

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: similar to RNA sequence, other RNA

FIELD.LABEL: INFERACC
FIELD.NAME: Inference accession
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A reference to a database entry, must contain an accession and version, or an algorithm including version. Must have the field Inference Type selected. Example: FM123456.1.

FIELD.LABEL: EXPERIMENT
FIELD.NAME: Experiment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Brief description of the nature of the experimental evidence that supports the feature. Example: in vitro coupled transcription and translation assay.

DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Genome Survey Sequence (GSS)
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: Genome Survey Sequence (GSS)
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For submission of Genome Survey Sequences (GSS). These are short DNA sequences which inlude: random single pass genome survey sequences, single pass reads from cosmid/BAC/YAC ends (may be chromosome specific), exon trapped genomic sequences, Alu PCR sequences and transposon-tagged sequences.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Fundamental information

FIELD.LABEL: ORGANISM_NAME
FIELD.NAME: Organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Full name of organism (generally Genus+species), NCBI taxid, BioSample accession, SRA sample accession, or sample alias. Formal names should include subspecies (subsp.), variety (var.) and forma (f.) if applicable. Example: Escherichia coli, uncultured bacterium, Nicotiana tabacum.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sample that has been sequenced. Example: isolate#3, 654g14.

FIELD.LABEL: CLONE_LIB
FIELD.NAME: Clone library
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name given to the sequenced clone library. Example: meristem, lib1.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier given to each clone in a sequenced library. Example: a2314_1296, lib1_b_9.

FIELD.LABEL: ISOLATION_SOURCE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical geography of sampling/isolation site. Example: fast-flowing river, cloud forest.

FIELD.LABEL: VARIETY

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: variety (= varietas, a formal Linnaean rank) of organism from which sequence was derived. Use the cultivar qualifier for cultivated plant varieties, i.e., products of artificial selection.

FIELD.LABEL: CULTIVAR

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cultivar (cultivated variety) of plant from which sequence was obtained, and is applied solely to products of artificial selection; use the variety qualifier for natural, named plant and fungal varieties.

FIELD.LABEL: BREED

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat.

FIELD.LABEL: MATING_TYPE

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mating type of prokaryotes and eukaryotes that undergo meiosis without sexually dimorphic gametes. Example: plus, minus.

FIELD.LABEL: SEX
FIELD.NAME: Sex of organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Sex of organism sequence. Example: male, female, mixed.

FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Geographical coordinates of the location where the specimen was collected, in decimal degrees (to 2 places); 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E. Example: 47.94 N 28.12 W or 45.01 S 4.12 E.
